byline.contributor: Myra Noveck and Irit Pazner contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Carol Sutherland from Moshav Ben Ami, Israel.

abstract: Memo from Israel; Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, who has been dogged by corruption allegations large and small for years, shows uncanny ability to emerge unscathed by tapping into psyche of Israeli people and maintaining their support.
lead_paragraph: The new attorney general says he will take a hard line, but Mr. Netanyahu has shown he can slip away from accusations with Teflon-coated ease.
snippet: The new attorney general says he will take a hard line, but Mr. Netanyahu has shown he can slip away from accusations with Teflon-coated ease....

headline.main: Israel’s Benjamin Netanyahu, Still a Step Ahead of Scandals, Faces a New Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Amid a Roar of Accusations, the ‘Underdog’ Remains Unscathed
